subject: Re: [junit] How to test a method without the return value by junit?
msgSnippet: If the method doesn t return anything then it probably modifies fields of the class somehow.  You can therefore test the value of this changed object. ie:
messageBody:
If the method doesn't return anything then it probably modifies fields
of the class somehow. You can therefore test the value of this changed
object. ie:

public class Foo
{
int x;

public Foo(int x)
{
this.x=x;
}

public int getX()
{
return x;
}

public void incrementX()
{
x++;
}
}

public class FooTest extends TestCase
{
public void testIncrementX()
{
Foo foo=new Foo(5);
foo.incrementX();
assertEquals(6,foo.getX());
}
}

chenhuitao@... wrote:
>
> I am a newbie to junit.But now i have a job in my hand.I need to use
> JUnit to test some existed java programme.Some methods of classes
> have no return value.I can not change the source programme.How can I
> test these programme by JUnit?
> Thank you for your any help!
> //BR ChenHuitao
